text: Lake Arin (in Turkish: Arin Gölü; also Sodalı Göl) is a soda lake in Turkey. It is a part of Adilcevaz ilçe (district) of Bitlis Province. The mid point of the lake is at . Map page The lake is to the east of Adilcevaz and separated from Lake Van, the biggest lake of Turkey by alluvial deposits Bitlis Info of only width. The elevation of the lake is . The area of the lake is about . Gadwall, red-crested pochard and ruddy duck are among the birds of the lake. Lake Arin page ==References== Arin Category:Landforms of Bitlis Province Category:Important Bird Areas of Turkey
title: Lake Arin
